name: scam-directive

schema.title: SCAM Directive Generator Options Schema

examples.description: Generate a `MySampleDirective` directive in a `my-sample` folder in the `my-lib` library

schema.description: Creates a new, generic Angular directive definition in the given or default project.

path.description: The file path to the SCAM directive without the file extension and suffix (e.g. `my-app/src/app/my-scam/my-scam` generates the file `my-app/src/app/my-scam/my-scam.directive.ts`). Relative to the current working directory.
path.x-prompt: What is the SCAM directive file path?

name.description: The directive symbol name. It not provided, it defaults to the last segment of the provided `path`.

skipTests.description: Do not create `spec.ts` test files for the new directive.

inlineScam.description: Create the `NgModule` in the same file as the Directive.

selector.description: The `HTML` selector to use for this directive.

prefix.description: The prefix to apply to the generated directive selector.

export.description: Specifies if the SCAM should be exported from the project's entry point (normally `index.ts`). It only applies to libraries.

description: Generate a directive with an accompanying Single Component Angular Module (SCAM).
